data.title: Hold click speed is too fast.
data.body: In Dune2000, when I try to move units while moving the mouse, most of the times it triggers the selecting rectangle, so it cancels the selection of the units I was trying to move. Delaying the hold click trigger some milliseconds would fix it.

data.title: Move voxel loader to Mods.Cnc.
data.body:
One of the big focuses of the next release has been decentralizing our engine so that modders aren't restricted by our default engine/mods install.  #13223 fell nicely under this umbrella point, leaving the voxel code as the last hardcoded format, and also the last piece of reverse-engineered proprietary logic in the core engine.

This PR fixes that by separating our voxel code into a generic model loading interface in the engine, and moving the voxel-specific code to Mods.Cnc.dll.  Once this has been merged we can proudly announce that our core engine is 100% free / clean code ðŸŽ‰.  This also makes it a lot easier to implement #4689 at some point in the future.

This isn't nearly as intimidating as it looks, and should be straightforward to review if you go commit by commit (but note that github has messed up the display order).
The only real changes are in:
* "Add backend plumbing for model loaders.": implements new backend for defining and creating the mod-level model loaders and model sequence merging.
* "Move Voxel code to Mods.Cnc.": Ports the old `VoxelProvider` code over to the new `VoxelModelSequenceLoader`.

Everything else is just renaming or moving code.

The old code relied on static state, with `ModData.InitializeLoaders` manually clearing and reloading the state as part of the map load.  The new code has `ModelCache` owned by the  `World`, which gives the same lifetime as before but without the ugly manual management.

I have not written an upgrade rule for the `VoxelSequences` → `ModelSequences` map yaml rename because that would mean bumping the map format for a feature that we don't use at all in our default mods and which we don't officially support yet for modders.

I will rename the `WithVoxel*` traits in a followup PR to reduce the rebase conflicts that come with renaming and upgrade rules.

data.title: Added Polygon IHitShape

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
Finally created the polygon hit shape. Right now it checks a point against every line segment (edge); I may look into improvements for convex polygons but testing should provided whether or not it would be needed or even very useful.

I didn't actually make use of the new hit-shape in any of the mods.

Closes #11362.

data.title: Type: Support for Demolition:/Demolishable:
data.body: I was trying to add Terror Drones to my D2K mod, using a long `Demolition: DetonationDelay:` to replicate the Anti-Vehicle effect. But as D2K also have Saboteurs who uses `Demolition:` tag and what those units can enter doesn't match, so i need `Type:` for `Demolition:` and `Demolishable:`

data.title: Move macOS builds to 64 bit.
data.body:
From https://developer.apple.com/videos/play/wwdc2017/102/

> High Sierra will be the last macOS release to support 32-bit apps without compromises.
> From the next major release after High Sierra we are going to start aggressively warning users if apps are not compatible with 64 bit.

This gives us about 12 - 15 months to move to a 64 bit build.  Apple will be removing 32 bit support entirely in a further year or so, so there is no point offering a fat binary with both architectures.

Mono 5.0 now ships with the 64 bit runtime, so the technical parts are easy:
* Recompile `libSDL2.dylib` and `liblua.5.1.dylib` as 64 bit.
* Change `-m32` to `-m64` in the [osx launcher makefile](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRALauncherOSX/blob/master/Makefile)
* Bump our minimum mono requirement to 5.0.

The launcher should then automatically load and use the 64 bit runtime.

Before we do this we need to make sure we understand and prepare for any potential stability or performance effects.  The best way to do this will be to collect a few representative replays for the main mods recorded on the current (32 bit) release, and then play them back using `mono64`.  Comparing the play times should give us some stats on the overall perf changes, and any runtime incompatibilities will manifest as desyncs.

data.title: Investigate adding 'u' footprint letter for 'occupied, but untargetable'
data.body:
I know we generally want to avoid anything hacky, but the sheer amount of work and yaml lines we could save on targetable offsets if it was possible to blacklist cells for `HitShape.UseOccupiedCellsOffsets` is massive.

Especially in TS (and likely RA2), but to some extend also in RA and TD, there are quite a few buildings with cells that occupy ground, but are not really visually part of the structure art (dust, debris, tiny fences, lamp posts, or just 90% empty with a bit of a corner/edge from the building).

If we added another letter for `Building.Footprint` that gets treated like 'x' for everything except targeting, the majority of TS civilian buildings that would otherwise need custom offsets to look good, as wells as quite a number of RA/TD buildings (again, mostly civilian buildings) would be perfectly fine with `UseOccupiedCellsOffsets: true`.

In addition, I used this opportunity to do some cleanup and add two properties that might be useful for modders.

data.title: Attack move inconsitency betwen Heli and Planes
data.body:
Heli: after attack move and running out of ammo, it will reload and comback and continue with attack move

Plane: It will run out, reload and will not leave the airfield. Unless this is intended, in C&C Generals, aircrafts had "guard area" which behaved similar to above heli behavior.

https://youtu.be/Pb7YtlVp3cs

Sort of related to bigger issue of #12564

data.title: Undeploying iron curtained MCV, vehicle will not inherit the iron curtain
data.body: Undeploying iron curtained MCV, vehicle will not inherit the iron curtain

data.title: INotifyBuildComplete not used correctly.
data.body:
There are currently a lot of traits, which should only get active after INotifyBuildComplete is triggered.
While this does not make a huge impact on the core games (due to extremely fast deploy or make animations), but this is a huge gameplay breaker for mods which have longer make animations or custom make code (in my case it can take a minute).

- Production should only be possible if the building is fully build up
- ProvidesPrerequisite should only provide if the building is fully build up
- Free actor should spawn the actor after the building is fully build up
- Traits which grant special abilities like the radar, spyplane, etc.
- Buildings granting the player money each X ticks, should only be active after the building is fully build up.

Feel free to add missing ones here. Basically a building in construction state / not have called implementing methods, should be fully dis-functional and should under no circumstances provide any features to the player. Sadly i do not have a list of all traits yet which should be affected, but the above mirror the ones i need for my project to behave correctly.

data.title: Repair bridge command can't be queued
data.body: In RepairsBridge.cs, there is CancelActivity() just before queueing RepairBridge activity. Their capture order can be queued, on the other hand.

data.title: Mad Tank moves after deploy with attack order
data.body:
Normally you can't make them move after deploying.
However, if you queue it by giving it an attack order mad tank deploys and moves while thumping. It doesn't seem to blow.

https://youtu.be/UFqJG38KHbY

data.title: Dune2000 drops players with moderate and good pings
data.body: As the title says, it always drops players with moderate ping, and sometimes it drops players with good ping at the start of the game. We can rarely get a game going without at least one of us getting dropped.

data.title: Dune2000 runs in slow motion
data.body: It runs like if it's in a PS2 emulator. The original Dune2000 just runs perfect without any performance problems. My specs are 4 GB RAM, Nvidia Geforce 410M (512MB VRAM) and Intel Core I3-2350M. I have windows 7 64 bit.

data.body: `CheckDefintions` will crash when `imageOverride` is `null` anyway.

data.body: Reduces base damage from 1000 to 750, and re-increases the delay between bombs, making first and last bomb usually miss the target.

data.title: Fix Sound memory leak, remove Music caching
data.body:
1. Fix Sound memory leak causing OutOfMemoryException and high RAM usage on each match start
2. Remove Music caching to avoid unnecessary high RAM usage

Example: 3 times match restart in RA, skipping several music tracks on each start - 327 MB vs 1074 MB:

![obrazok](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16348750/26796009/160dcfca-4a28-11e7-9a44-8ae6e52c3244.png)
